This. Game. ROCKS.
Also netcode sucks

After playing Killing Floor for hundreds of hours, finishing most of the maps for 50 times, you would expect you saw everything in a Coop vs. AI game. 
But this game still amazes me,  i still experience surprises and moments where the temperature rises and you want to jump up from your chair because you are so thrilled. 
Moments where you walk around a corner, thinking you leave all enemies behind, and suddenly running into a fat Fleshpound still make this game an entertaining masterpiece of video game design.

In terms of longevity this game surpasses all other coop games and most of the competitive games i played so far. 
Sure, this game takes some time to show off its full potential, you need to learn which class suits your play style, how the different Zeds react to your fire, which weapons are effective against which enemy and so on. 
But if you take your time, you are rewarded with complex game mechanics that compliment teamwork, map knowledge and cleverness so much that you cannot help but enjoy Killing Floor.

"I came for the blood, but I stayed for the fun"

Ass whooping game for everyone, I suggest you buy it asap.

this game is superbly fun. forget L4D2, with its limited guns, and "chaptered" gameplay. Killing floor drops you into a world with limited ammo, and only one gun(inless you level up), to survive waves of mutated zombies who are out to do one thing. KILL, EAT, and REPEAT till everyone is gone. games are up to 6 player co-ops, and you must survive all rounds, then youve got your patriarch, hes nasty, big, and hits like a truck. L4D2 has not had any updates as of late, where as killing floor updates anywhere from 2 to 30 times a year, releasing new maps for FREE, guns released are basically reskins and are a paid DLC. killing floor is easily the best zombie shoot'em up game ever.

This, this right here, this is how you do a zombie game. The best way to describe this thing is if you take Zombie Mode from CoD, add the atmosphere and special infected from House Of The Dead, combine it with L4D's squad system, mix in Counter Strike's weapon purchasing system, and wrap the whole thing in TF2's wide varity of characters with heavy British overtones. Although...I strongly suggest that you avoid going it alone. You will die, A LOT, without a good team. Find someone who knows what they're doing and stick with them, otherwise, you'll be surronded so fast you won't know what happened until after your ragequit.
YEEEEEEESSSSSSS DONT THINK ABOUT IT DO IT DO IT NOW BUY IT JUST CLICK ADD TO CART RIGHT SHNOWWWWWWWWWWWWW!!!!!!!!!!!

Must buy if you like the sound of coop / leveling / shooters in one. People with a challenge fetish need not worry as highest difficulty (Hell on Earth) is near impossible. Plenty of achievements to earn and bonus characters to unlock. Special events tend to change enemy aesthetics and throw in new maps- recent one even added new weapons! I can't recommend this game hard enough if you enjoy shooters.  
    Classes include: Field Medic (healer), Support Specialist (shotguns), Sharpshooter (single target dps), Commando (consistent dps), Berserker (melee), Firebug (fire damage), and finally Demolitions (explosives).  Basically the previous mentioned are just "perks" that give bonuses of sorts and you can use any weapon you want.  Perks are increased/obtained through leveling to level 6 (max).

As Killing Floor currently has a Xmas event and a FREE weekend, it seems a good time to update my recommendation. This is a coop FPS similar to L4D, but the objective is to survive waves of zombies, rather than travel from A to B. The action is really intense, especially on higher difficulties, and there are a variety of roles to play and weapons to use. KF also has the BEST FPS community I've seen. Most players use teamwork, cover and heal each other, share cash between waves to help others buy better weapons. Tripwire support the game with special events, new maps, weapons, skins and achievements. Servers are more stable than L4D, and if a player ragequits, the game adjusts the number of zombies so its not automatically a lost cause (no useless bots!). One of the best value for money purchases I've ever made.
Just the game for Every Zombie / Mutant hating gamer :P  Start the game and shoot em up :) FUN FUN FUN

I like how metacritic lists this as being a 72/100 while it's deserves a lower 90 at least. This shows how corrupt the "professional" videogame authors are. Obviously they didn't get their advance bribes before this game was released, but I digress. 

Everything about this game is great. I won't quibble about the graphics because they all look the bloody same now: good enough. The only people I would warn this game about are the ones who hate multiplayer games as there is no single player campaign to speak of. That's fine because this game obviously was built for one thing: cooperative gameplay. I've never seen teamwork like this in an online game, ever. Hell, in TF2 everyone is a retard and runs off to do their own thing - not so in killing floor. The best incentive for teamwork is not losing the game every match. 

This game is well-worth the cash. PIck up a copy as soon as you can; you will not regret it. It's a cheap game that could have been sold at triple-A prices

Plenty of fun if you just want to hop into a pure shooter for about an 30 minutes to an hour. No real story here just hop in a map and kill some mutated zombie monsters :P. Game drops below $10 on a regular basis though so dont pay more then that.

No está mal como Survival cooperativo. Es un poco inestable, si se compara con el Left 4 Dead y de gráfico un pelín peores.

Lo bueno es que tiene como "clases" que puedes escoger:  Comando, médico, demolicines, berserker... Jugar con cada uno hace que vayas subiendo de nivel, mejorando la clase.

Además, las armas aunque se encuentran a modo de pick ups, la manera básica de obtenerlas es comprándolas con dinero que te van dando entre rondas de bichos, lo que hace que se pueda ir adquiriendo las armas que se prefieran.

Resumen: No está mal si se adquiere a bajo precio y se tiene amigos con los que jugar. Eso si, al cabo de un rato, resulta repetitivo.
Great game that the dev continues to support.

Sehr gutes Spiel, das mich trotz etlicher Stunden immer noch zu fesseln weiß. Anfangs macht das Levelsystem der Perks einern großen Anreiz aus, immer weiter zu leveln. Aber auch wenn man alle Perks auf Maximalstufe gebracht hat, bleibt das Spiel auf den höheren Levels sehr anspruchsvoll, da hier ausschließlich gutes und durchdachtes Teamplay zum Erfolg führt. 
Positiv ist auch der immer noch sehr gute Support seitens Tripwire, denn es kommen immer wieder witzige und motivierende Events (Halloween, Circus, Christmas usw.), die mit neuen Inhalten aufwarten (Maps, Waffen, Achievments usw.). Einen Wermutstropfen gibt es allerdings; die deutsche Version ist sehr stark geschnitten. Dies wäre ja an und für sich kein all zu großes Problem, wenn es lediglich mit dem Verlust von Spielatmosphäre einhergehen würde. Leider stört es aber auch deutlich das Gameplay selbst, da Zombies beispielsweise sehr merkwürdig bzw. verzögert umkippen und man deshalb unfreiwillig Kugeln verschwendet.
